name: International Road Transport Union Permanent Delegation to the EU
goal: The IRU Permanent Delegation to the EU was established in 1973 as an independent body, with its own statutes, in Brussels, Belgium.  It's mission is to support IRU EU Member Associations in monitoring and ensuring informed legislation on all issues dealt with by the EU institutions that affect road transport.
interests: Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Competition, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
All legislations concerning commercial road transport (buses, coaches, trucks and taxis).
Futur planned proposals and legislations originating from the EU institutions and its Members states.
Recent issues include: social legislation measures in Members states, Weight & Dimensions legislation for commercial road vehicules, future EC road package.
